levels.title: Introduction to Business
levels.description: Learn the basic concepts of what a business is and how it operates.

levels.title: Types of Business Structures
levels.description: Understand sole proprietorships, partnerships, and corporations.

levels.title: What is Finance?
levels.description: An overview of personal, corporate, and public finance.

levels.title: The Three Financial Statements
levels.description: A high-level introduction to the Income Statement, Balance Sheet, and Cash Flow Statement.

levels.title: The Income Statement
levels.description: Understand revenues, expenses, and profit.

levels.title: The Balance Sheet
levels.description: Learn about assets, liabilities, and equity (A = L + E).

levels.title: The Cash Flow Statement
levels.description: Track the movement of cash from operating, investing, and financing activities.

levels.title: Introduction to Accounting
levels.description: Understand the language of business.

levels.title: Debits and Credits
levels.description: Learn the fundamental concept of double-entry bookkeeping.

levels.title: Supply and Demand
levels.description: The core concept of economics.

levels.title: Introduction to Microsoft Excel
levels.description: Learn the basics of the most important tool in finance.

levels.title: Basic Excel Formulas (SUM, AVERAGE)
levels.description: Perform simple calculations in Excel.

levels.title: Time Value of Money (TVM)
levels.description: Understand why a dollar today is worth more than a dollar tomorrow.

levels.title: Simple vs. Compound Interest
levels.description: Learn how interest is calculated and grows over time.

levels.title: What are Stocks and Bonds?
levels.description: An introduction to the two main asset classes.

levels.title: What is a Stock Market?
levels.description: Understand how stocks are bought and sold.

levels.title: Introduction to Budgeting
levels.description: Learn to create and manage a personal or business budget.

levels.title: Fixed vs. Variable Costs
levels.description: Understand the different types of business costs.

levels.title: What is a Business Plan?
levels.description: Learn the components of a basic business plan.

levels.title: The 4 P's of Marketing
levels.description: Understand Product, Price, Place, and Promotion.

levels.title: SWOT Analysis
levels.description: Analyze a business's Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, and Threats.

levels.title: Revenue vs. Profit
levels.description: Understand the crucial difference between them.

levels.title: Assets vs. Liabilities
levels.description: Grasp the core components of the balance sheet.

levels.title: Introduction to Financial Ratios
levels.description: Learn how to use ratios to analyze a company's health.

levels.title: Excel: Cell Formatting
levels.description: Make your spreadsheets readable and professional.

levels.title: Excel: Creating Simple Charts
levels.description: Visualize your data with bar and pie charts.

levels.title: Future Value and Present Value
levels.description: Calculate the value of money across time.

levels.title: What are Mutual Funds and ETFs?
levels.description: Learn about diversified investment vehicles.

levels.title: Risk and Return
levels.description: Understand the fundamental trade-off in investing.

levels.title: Diversification
levels.description: Learn why you shouldn't put all your eggs in one basket.

levels.title: What is a Bank?
levels.description: Understand the role of banks in the economy.

levels.title: Types of Bank Accounts
levels.description: Learn about checking, savings, and money market accounts.

levels.title: Introduction to Credit
levels.description: Understand what credit is and how it works.

levels.title: Credit Scores
levels.description: Learn what a credit score is and why it's important.

levels.title: What is a Loan?
levels.description: Understand the basics of borrowing money.

levels.title: Business Ethics
levels.description: Learn about ethical conduct in the business world.

levels.title: Introduction to Management
levels.description: Understand the basic functions of management: planning, organizing, leading, controlling.

levels.title: Introduction to Entrepreneurship
levels.description: Learn what it takes to start your own business.

levels.title: What is an Invoice?
levels.description: Understand the basics of billing clients.

levels.title: Introduction to Financial Markets
levels.description: Learn about primary and secondary markets.

levels.title: What is an IPO?
levels.description: Understand how a private company goes public.

levels.title: Bull vs. Bear Markets
levels.description: Learn the difference between a rising and falling market.

levels.title: Core Economic Indicators (GDP, Inflation)
levels.description: Understand how to measure the health of an economy.

levels.title: The Role of Central Banks
levels.description: Learn about institutions like the Federal Reserve and RBI.

levels.title: Monetary Policy
levels.description: Understand how central banks influence the economy.

levels.title: Fiscal Policy
levels.description: Understand how governments influence the economy through spending and taxation.

levels.title: Introduction to PowerPoint
levels.description: Learn the basics of creating professional presentations.

levels.title: Presenting Financial Information
levels.description: Learn how to communicate data effectively.

levels.title: What is a Startup?
levels.description: Understand the characteristics of a high-growth new venture.

levels.title: The Business Model Canvas
levels.description: A simple framework for designing a business model.

levels.title: Cash vs. Accrual Accounting
levels.description: Learn the two methods of recording transactions.

levels.title: Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP)
levels.description: An overview of the standard accounting framework.

levels.title: Excel: VLOOKUP Function
levels.description: A powerful function for finding data in a table.

levels.title: Annuities and Perpetuities
levels.description: Understand these common cash flow patterns.

levels.title: What is an Opportunity Cost?
levels.description: The value of the next-best alternative when making a decision.

levels.title: Break-Even Analysis
levels.description: Calculate the point at which a business starts to make a profit.

levels.title: Gross Margin vs. Net Margin
levels.description: Understand different measures of profitability.

levels.title: Introduction to Insurance
levels.description: Learn how insurance works to manage risk.

levels.title: Types of Insurance
levels.description: An overview of health, life, and property insurance.

levels.title: Introduction to Taxation
levels.description: Understand the basics of how taxes work.

levels.title: What is a Supply Chain?
levels.description: Learn the process of getting a product from supplier to customer.

levels.title: Introduction to Operations Management
levels.description: Understand how businesses produce goods and services efficiently.

levels.title: What is Human Resources?
levels.description: Learn the role of HR in managing a company's people.

levels.title: Project Management Basics
levels.description: Understand the lifecycle of a project.

levels.title: Leadership vs. Management
levels.description: Learn the key differences.

levels.title: Negotiation Basics
levels.description: Learn fundamental strategies for effective negotiation.

levels.title: Introduction to Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR)
levels.description: Understand how businesses can have a positive social impact.

levels.title: What is a Brand?
levels.description: Learn what makes a strong brand.

levels.title: Market Research Basics
levels.description: Understand how to gather information about your target market.

levels.title: Project: Create a Personal Budget
levels.description: Track your income and expenses for one month.

levels.title: Project: Analyze a Public Company's Stock
levels.description: Use public data to research a company you know.

levels.title: Project: Simple Business Idea Pitch
levels.description: Outline a business idea using the Business Model Canvas.

levels.title: Project: Read a Company's Annual Report
levels.description: Find and review the key sections of an annual report.

levels.title: Final Project: Basic Financial Statement Analysis
levels.description: Analyze the three financial statements of a public company.

levels.title: Building a 3-Statement Financial Model
levels.description: Link the Income Statement, Balance Sheet, and Cash Flow Statement in Excel.

levels.title: Financial Ratio Analysis
levels.description: Calculate and interpret liquidity, profitability, and leverage ratios.

levels.title: Working Capital Management
levels.description: Manage current assets and liabilities for optimal efficiency.

levels.title: Valuation Methods Overview
levels.description: An introduction to DCF, Comparable Company Analysis, and Precedent Transactions.

levels.title: Comparable Company Analysis (Comps)
levels.description: Value a company by comparing it to similar public companies.

levels.title: Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) Analysis
levels.description: Value a company based on the present value of its future cash flows.

levels.title: Calculating the Weighted Average Cost of Capital (WACC)
levels.description: Determine the discount rate for a DCF analysis.

levels.title: Capital Budgeting (NPV and IRR)
levels.description: Evaluate the profitability of potential investments or projects.

levels.title: Capital Asset Pricing Model (CAPM)
levels.description: Calculate the expected return of an asset.

levels.title: Modern Portfolio Theory (MPT)
levels.description: Construct portfolios to optimize return for a given level of risk.

levels.title: Efficient Market Hypothesis
levels.description: Understand the theory that asset prices reflect all available information.

levels.title: Behavioral Finance
levels.description: Explore how psychological biases affect investor decisions.

levels.title: Equity Research Reports
levels.description: Learn to read and analyze reports from sell-side analysts.

levels.title: Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A)
levels.description: Understand the process and motivations behind M&A deals.

levels.title: Leveraged Buyouts (LBOs)
levels.description: Learn how private equity firms use debt to acquire companies.

levels.title: Introduction to Derivatives
levels.description: Learn about options, futures, and swaps.

levels.title: Options Basics (Calls and Puts)
levels.description: Understand the fundamentals of option contracts.

levels.title: Fixed Income Analysis
levels.description: Analyze bonds and other debt securities.

levels.title: Credit Analysis
levels.description: Assess the creditworthiness of a company or individual.

levels.title: Corporate Governance
levels.description: Understand the systems that direct and control a company.

levels.title: Financial Forecasting
levels.description: Project a company's future financial performance.

levels.title: Advanced Excel: Pivot Tables
levels.description: Summarize and analyze large datasets in Excel.

levels.title: Advanced Excel: Data Tables and Scenario Manager
levels.description: Perform sensitivity analysis in your models.

levels.title: International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS)
levels.description: Understand the global accounting standards.

levels.title: Revenue Recognition Principles
levels.description: Learn how and when companies can recognize revenue.

levels.title: Inventory Accounting (FIFO, LIFO)
levels.description: Understand different methods of accounting for inventory.

levels.title: Depreciation Methods
levels.description: Learn how companies account for the decline in value of assets.

levels.title: Introduction to Corporate Finance
levels.description: Understand the key decisions made by corporate finance professionals.

levels.title: Capital Structure
levels.description: Analyze a company's mix of debt and equity financing.

levels.title: Dividend Policy
levels.description: Understand why and how companies pay dividends.

levels.title: Introduction to Venture Capital
levels.description: Learn how startups get funded.

levels.title: Pitch Deck Analysis
levels.description: Learn to evaluate a startup's pitch deck.

levels.title: Term Sheets and Valuation
levels.description: Understand the key terms in a venture financing deal.

levels.title: Private Equity
levels.description: Learn about investing in private companies.

levels.title: Hedge Funds
levels.description: Understand the strategies used by hedge funds.

levels.title: Investment Banking
levels.description: An overview of the roles and functions of an investment bank.

levels.title: Business Law and Contracts
levels.description: Understand the legal framework of business.

levels.title: Intellectual Property (Patents, Trademarks)
levels.description: Learn how to protect a company's intangible assets.

levels.title: Macroeconomic Analysis
levels.description: Analyze the impact of economic trends on businesses.

levels.title: Porter's Five Forces
levels.description: A framework for analyzing industry competition.

levels.title: Value Chain Analysis
levels.description: Identify a company's primary and support activities.

levels.title: Blue Ocean Strategy
levels.description: Learn how to create uncontested market space.

levels.title: Forensic Accounting
levels.description: Detecting fraud and financial misrepresentation.

levels.title: Technical Analysis of Stocks
levels.description: Use charts and patterns to predict future price movements.

levels.title: Algorithmic Trading Strategies
levels.description: An introduction to automated trading systems.

levels.title: Risk Management Frameworks (COSO)
levels.description: Understand how organizations manage risk.

levels.title: Financial Derivatives for Hedging
levels.description: Use derivatives to reduce financial risk.

levels.title: Structured Finance and Securitization
levels.description: Learn how assets are pooled and sold to investors.

levels.title: Real Estate Finance and Investment
levels.description: Analyze real estate as an asset class.

levels.title: Project Finance
levels.description: Learn how large infrastructure projects are financed.

levels.title: Supply Chain Management
levels.description: Optimize the flow of goods, services, and information.

levels.title: Lean and Six Sigma
levels.description: Methodologies for process improvement and quality management.

levels.title: Change Management
levels.description: Lead organizations through significant change.

levels.title: Organizational Behavior
levels.description: Understand how people and groups act in organizations.

levels.title: Global Business Strategy
levels.description: Learn how to operate a business in a global context.

levels.title: Emerging Markets
levels.description: Understand the opportunities and challenges of investing in developing economies.

levels.title: Sustainable and Impact Investing
levels.description: Align investments with environmental, social, and governance (ESG) criteria.

levels.title: FinTech and the Disruption of Finance
levels.description: Explore how technology is changing the financial industry.

levels.title: Blockchain and Cryptocurrencies
levels.description: Understand the technology and its financial implications.

levels.title: Introduction to Python for Finance
levels.description: Use libraries like Pandas and NumPy for financial analysis.

levels.title: Introduction to Financial APIs
levels.description: Pull stock prices and financial data programmatically.

levels.title: Building a Stock Screener
levels.description: Use code to filter stocks based on specific criteria.

levels.title: Backtesting a Trading Strategy
levels.description: Test the viability of a trading strategy on historical data.

levels.title: Project: Build a Detailed DCF Model
levels.description: Create a 5-year DCF valuation for a public company.

levels.title: Project: LBO Model
levels.description: Build a simplified LBO model for a company.

levels.title: Final Project: Equity Research Report
levels.description: Write a complete 'buy' or 'sell' recommendation for a stock.

levels.title: Advanced M&A Modeling
levels.description: Model accretion/dilution and other complex M&A effects.

levels.title: Corporate Restructuring
levels.description: Analyze spin-offs, split-offs, and divestitures.

levels.title: Bankruptcy and Distress Investing
levels.description: Understand Chapter 11 and how to value distressed assets.

levels.title: Option Pricing Models (Black-Scholes)
levels.description: The mathematical model for pricing European-style options.

levels.title: The 'Greeks' in Options Trading
levels.description: Understand Delta, Gamma, Theta, and Vega.

levels.title: Advanced Options Strategies
levels.description: Learn about spreads, straddles, and condors.

levels.title: Volatility Trading
levels.description: Trade instruments based on market volatility, like the VIX.

levels.title: Quantitative Portfolio Management
levels.description: Use mathematical models to construct and manage portfolios.

levels.title: Factor Investing
levels.description: Build portfolios based on factors like value, momentum, and size.

levels.title: Machine Learning for Trading
levels.description: Apply ML techniques to predict market movements.

levels.title: High-Frequency Trading (HFT)
levels.description: An overview of the strategies and technologies behind HFT.

levels.title: Interest Rate Swaps and Credit Default Swaps (CDS)
levels.description: Understand complex derivative instruments.

levels.title: Advanced Financial Statement Analysis
levels.description: Detect earnings manipulation and other red flags.

levels.title: Valuation of Financial Institutions
levels.description: Learn the unique methods for valuing banks and insurance companies.

levels.title: Private Wealth Management
levels.description: Advise high-net-worth individuals on their finances.

levels.title: Tax and Estate Planning
levels.description: Strategies for minimizing taxes and transferring wealth.

levels.title: International Taxation
levels.description: Understand the complexities of cross-border taxation.

levels.title: Actuarial Science Basics
levels.description: Apply mathematical and statistical methods to assess risk in insurance and finance.

levels.title: Advanced Corporate Finance: Capital Allocation
levels.description: Decide how to best invest a company's capital.

levels.title: Share Buybacks vs. Dividends
levels.description: A deep dive into the debate on returning capital to shareholders.

levels.title: Corporate Strategy
levels.description: Set the long-term direction and goals of a corporation.

levels.title: Game Theory in Business
levels.description: Analyze strategic interactions between competitors.

levels.title: Real Options Analysis
levels.description: Value the flexibility in business decisions.

levels.title: Decentralized Finance (DeFi)
levels.description: Explore the world of permissionless financial applications on the blockchain.

levels.title: Yield Farming and Liquidity Mining
levels.description: Understand how to earn returns in DeFi.

levels.title: Tokenomics
levels.description: Analyze the economic design of a cryptocurrency.

levels.title: VBA and Macros for Excel
levels.description: Automate complex tasks in Excel.

levels.title: Monte Carlo Simulation for Finance
levels.description: Model the probability of different outcomes.

levels.title: Python for Algorithmic Trading
levels.description: Build and backtest a complete trading algorithm.

levels.title: Leading Organizational Change
levels.description: Successfully guide a company through a major transformation.

levels.title: Cross-Cultural Negotiation
levels.description: Negotiate effectively across different cultures.

levels.title: Business Turnaround Strategy
levels.description: Develop and implement a plan to save a failing company.

levels.title: Managing a Global Team
levels.description: Lead and motivate a team distributed across the world.

levels.title: Geopolitical Risk Analysis
levels.description: Assess the impact of political events on markets and businesses.

levels.title: Circular Economy Business Models
levels.description: Design businesses that are sustainable and regenerative.

levels.title: Valuation of Intangible Assets
levels.description: Learn to value patents, brands, and goodwill.

levels.title: Stochastic Calculus for Finance
levels.description: The mathematics behind many quantitative finance models.

levels.title: Commodities and Energy Trading
levels.description: Understand the markets for oil, gas, metals, and agricultural products.

levels.title: Foreign Exchange (Forex) Markets
levels.description: A deep dive into the largest financial market in the world.

levels.title: Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs)
levels.description: The future of money.

levels.title: The Role of a CFO
levels.description: Understand the responsibilities of a Chief Financial Officer.

levels.title: The Role of a CEO
levels.description: Understand the responsibilities of a Chief Executive Officer.

levels.title: Board of Directors and Shareholder Activism
levels.description: Understand the dynamics of corporate control.

levels.title: Securities Law
levels.description: A deeper understanding of the legal aspects of issuing and trading securities.

levels.title: Antitrust and Competition Law
levels.description: Understand the laws that govern M&A and market competition.

levels.title: Running an Investment Fund
levels.description: The operational and legal aspects of managing a fund.

levels.title: Final Project: Advise on a Live M&A Deal
levels.description: Analyze a current M&A deal and present a fairness opinion.

levels.title: Final Project: Create and Pitch a Hedge Fund Strategy
levels.description: Develop a unique investment strategy and pitch it.

levels.title: Final Project: Business Turnaround Case Study
levels.description: Act as a consultant to 'save' a publicly traded company.

levels.title: Raising a Venture Capital Fund
levels.description: Understand the process of raising capital from LPs.

levels.title: Due Diligence for Venture Capital
levels.description: The process of investigating a potential investment.

levels.title: Growth Equity Investing
levels.description: Investing in mature, high-growth companies.

levels.title: Special Purpose Acquisition Companies (SPACs)
levels.description: An alternative to a traditional IPO.

levels.title: Structured Products
levels.description: Understand complex, tailor-made investment products.

levels.title: Catastrophe Bonds and Insurance-Linked Securities
levels.description: Investing in insurance risk.

levels.title: Carbon Credit Trading
levels.description: The market for carbon emissions.

levels.title: Economic Moats
levels.description: Identify sustainable competitive advantages in businesses.

levels.title: The Innovator's Dilemma
levels.description: Why successful companies often fail to adapt.

levels.title: Systems Thinking for Business
levels.description: Analyze businesses as complex systems.

levels.title: Psychology of Leadership
levels.description: Understand the cognitive and emotional aspects of leading people.

levels.title: Executive Compensation Design
levels.description: Structure compensation to align management with shareholder interests.

levels.title: Managing Corporate Culture
levels.description: Intentionally shape the values and behaviors of an organization.

levels.title: The Future of Work
levels.description: Analyze trends like remote work, AI, and automation.

levels.title: Globalization vs. Deglobalization
levels.description: The changing landscape of the global economy.

levels.title: Thinking in Bets
levels.description: A probabilistic approach to decision-making under uncertainty.

levels.title: Capstone: Manage a Simulated Portfolio
levels.description: Manage a multi-asset portfolio through various market conditions.

levels.title: The Great Depression vs. 2008 Financial Crisis
levels.description: A comparative analysis of major financial crises.

levels.title: Financial History
levels.description: Learn from the bubbles, manias, and panics of the past.

levels.title: Philosophy of Economics
levels.description: Explore the underlying assumptions of economic theory.

levels.title: Advanced International Finance
levels.description: Managing currency risk and foreign investments.

levels.title: Financial Engineering
levels.description: Design and price new financial products.

levels.title: The Future of Capitalism
levels.description: Discusses potential evolutions of the capitalist model.

levels.title: Mock Interview: Private Equity Case Study
levels.description: Practice a PE case study from start to finish.

levels.title: Mock Interview: Hedge Fund Stock Pitch
levels.description: Develop and defend a long or short investment thesis.

levels.title: Mock Interview: Investment Banking M&A
levels.description: Walk through a hypothetical M&A transaction.

levels.title: Capstone: Develop a new FinTech product
levels.description: Design, prototype, and write a business plan for a new FinTech startup.

levels.title: Capstone: Value a complex, multi-national corporation
levels.description: Perform a sum-of-the-parts (SOTP) valuation.

levels.title: Capstone: Present to an Investment Committee
levels.description: Simulate a presentation to a board or investment committee.
